meanings.definition: Existing only in the imagination or fancy.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed the fanciful stories before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: Her paintings were filled with fanciful colors and shapes.
meanings.sent3: The fanciful idea of flying to the moon on a paper airplane made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His fanciful dreams of becoming a superhero inspired him to help others.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a fanciful paradise of blooming flowers and talking animals.

meanings.sent1: The artist's fanciful sculptures amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The costume designer created a fanciful outfit for the play.
meanings.sent3: In the fanciful world of make-believe, anything is possible.
meanings.sent4: Her fanciful imagination led her to design unique inventions.
meanings.sent5: The circus was a fanciful display of acrobats and clowns.

meanings.definition: Not based on reason or reality.
meanings.sent1: The scientist dismissed the fanciful theories as unscientific.
meanings.sent2: The novel was filled with fanciful characters in magical lands.
meanings.sent3: His fanciful excuses for being late were always entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises seemed fanciful and unrealistic.
meanings.sent5: The movie was a fanciful escape into a world of dragons and wizards.
